ExtendedSection.Title: Preparation 4: Connect the template with the website

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
In order to keep the /sites/examples/ website useful for other examples of this guide, the next steps show how to create a so called subsite and how to configure the example template from above for this subsite.

  • make sure that you are logged into the workplace and the /sites/examples/ website is selected
  • open the Sitemap editor, click on the wand icon, select the Function pages tab, and drag and drop a new Navigation level folder to your site
  • rename the newly created navigation level folder into Formatter configuration (formatter-configuration)
  • click on the burger menu of the newly created navigation level folder, choose Advanced and then Create sub-sitemap
  • open the /sites/examples/ folder with the Explorer
  • right-click on the /formatter-configuration/ subsite folder and, in the context menu, click on Properties to open the Properties dialog
  • set the value of the template property to /system/modules/org.opencms.examples.formatterconfig/templates/template.jsp
  • back to the sitemap editor, navigate to the /formatter-configuration/ sub-sitemap, click on the select view icon in the main toolbar and switch to the Templates view
  • click on the plus sign of the Template bar and create a new template called Default
  • click on the select view icon in the main toolbar and switch to the Sitemap view
  • click on the wand icon and drag and drop the newly created template model to the sitemap; rename the page into Test (test) in order to have an example page available
